Reviews.Title: “Good ratio for price/quality!”
Reviews.Author: BozoBucharest
Reviews.Content: Nice room, big bathroom,very clean, pleasant and helpful staff.The hotel has a good location, close to metro station, in a safe area - Sagrada. Breakfast is not like in a 5 star hotel but everything is fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get any better for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: Waleed A
Reviews.Content: Tight rooms anything else is excellent. Breakfast is good, location is amazing, their team is very friendly, close to the subway/metro/tube whichever you call it which takes you easily everywhere in a blink with very organized lines, close to bus stop to go to park Guel, so close to segragada. not only next to Gaudi street where night time is decent, but also the staff will guide you to everything in city day and night and also out of Barcelona if you would like to go for the beach and enjoy good time Seriously, Thank you Aristol for a great vacation time.

Reviews.Title: “I wish there was a 3 1/2 rating”
Reviews.Author: SusieLikes2Travel
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice 3 star hotel. It was very clean, had the most comfortable pillows I've ever slept on, had a decent breakfast selection, and was in a safe area of town. The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful - especially the woman who prepared the breakfast buffet and cleaned the rooms - she was a total gem! It is not a fancy hotel at all, but it provided a good night's sleep at a very reasonable rate. It was easy to find and proved to be a good home base for our week in Barcelona. One BIG compalint that I had was that one evening someone was either smoking in the room next to us or in the hall and the odor wafted into our room - GROSS! Other than that, it was perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to the Sagrada. Nice rooms, decent value.”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryCrisdean
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent 3 nights here while we explored Barcelona. It may seem out of the way; but it is only 4 blocks to two different metro stations. It is a short walk to the Sagrada Familia. It's located right beside the hospital San Pau. The rooms are very nice and the hotel staff are helpful. There are a ton of little cafes around for breakfast, so don't worry about paying 8euro for their breakfast. If you catch the blue line, beware. It is only four blocks to the hotel. However; it is also the station at the bottom of the every large hill that the hotel rests on. All in all, this is a good hotel in a decent location. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for conferences at the Hotel Sant Pau”
Reviews.Author: Gothicist
Reviews.Content: This was one of two hotels suggested by the organizers of a medical conference with representatives from 32 countries. Most of the rooms are small, but we decided to pay for an upgrade to one of the two rooms on the roof. This was much bigger and has excellent views of the old Gothic Revival hospital San Pau, and of the city beyond including the water company building that looks like the Gurkin in London. The hotel has been fully modernized and is very comfortable and pleasant. The front desk staff are thoughtful and helpful, but this is not a fully staffed large hotel for businessmen. You can easily walk (to the right) down hill several blocks to the calle Gaudi, a pedestrianized street that leads to the Sagrada Familia. The closer you get to the church the more touristy it is. The first part however is populated with Barcelonans. The location is not ideal for visitors not connected to the hospital or other nearby institutions. (The 1900-1930 old hospital is being converted to UN peace and other international entities.) Others should stay in the Passeo de Gracia or adjacent areas of the Eixample ("the extension") or if inclined toward tourist places supplemented by teenagers and edgy people, the Ramblas and old city of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “nice value for money”
Reviews.Author: Aspi123
Reviews.Content: clean place with modern amenities. close to sagrada and metro stn. at hospital. free/fast wifi and pc in lobby to use.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean, simple - great for short stays”
Reviews.Author: OrpheusBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days with my wife and young daughter while my wife was attending a conference. One of the cleanest hotels I've stayed in, without question. Small hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, smaller and relatively simple rooms--neither cramped nor spartan or bare-bones, just simple in terms of size, furnishings, and amenities (not truly business class, but certainly good enough for a short stay). Room had two twin beds, which we pushed together to make on larger bed for the 3 of us. Not sure if they have other bed options. Simple breakfast layout in the morning. Mini-fridge and safe in the room, no restaurant in the hotel, no room service, no gym or health club. That said, there's so much to see in Barcelona, we didn't miss those things at all. Plenty of cafes and small shops nearby. Right across the road from the sprawling Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau. Plan to take a taxi from the airport, about 25-30 minute ride. Don't know if there's parking available, if you have a car. Approximately 300m from the Guinardo subway station-- which made it truly easy to get around the city. By subway, it's about 15 minutes from La Rambla, the Barri Gotic and the harbor. If you're inclined to walk, it's about a 10 minute walk from the fantastic Sagrada Familia. Great to stroll around the neighborhood, but be prepared for some steep hills, depending on which way you go. One evening, we had to get off the subway early due to some problem on the line, and we had to walk about 20 blocks to the hotel, some parts quite steep - this is fine for adults, not quite so much for younger kids. That said, my daughter didn't complain (much) about the walk. The location won't keep me from recommending this hotel. I would stay here again if the price is right, but if you're looking for something more centrally located, you might not find this the best place to be. Again, friendly staff, clean and simple, overall a good value. Quirky bit of trivia: I read somewhere the building used to be the old Chinese consulate before it was converted to a hotel--this made it a bit cool and creepy at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “A SOUND CHOICE FOR A SHORT STAY”
Reviews.Author: DaveSpencer32
Reviews.Content: we have friends in this area of Barcelona and have stayed here before when visiting. It is a simple hotel , small , clean and efficient. There are no spare pillows but I would imagine they would soon produce them if asked. Breakfast is modest by even continental standards but if you have eaten at local times you will still be full from dinner. The rooms aren't 'soft' but they are clean and in good condition, a small amount of traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with Good Price”
Reviews.Author: bdwhite1
Reviews.Content: Small hotel right across the street from the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Hospital de Sant Pau". Very comfortable rooms with good A/C. Didn't really hear any ambulances. There aren't many english channels on the TV, but when you are in Barcelona, TV doesn't really matter. Service was very courteous. Didn't try the breakfast so no comment on that. The hotel is located up the hill from the direction of the sea, so the best metro to get off (if you are not taking a taxi) is also the closest- Guinardo/Hospital de Sant Pau, which happens to be the yellow line. The best walk from the hotel is this- turn right when you walk out of the door, heading downhill on Carrer de Cartagena. Take it until you get to the pedestrian boulevard Avinguda de Gaudi (small cars and motorcycles run on the sides). It runs diagonal to the other streets and begins right across the street from the main entrance to the historical part of Hospital de Sant Pau. You will be able to see a great view of the Sagrada Familia from here and the walkway continues all the way to the church. The street is lined with restaurants and cafes and is a very pleasant walk. FYI, a good grocery store is located right across the street from the hospital on Sant Antoni Maria Claret called Bon Preu. You can get tasty crossaints and sandwiches for good prices there to take to the beach!

Reviews.Title: “A clean, safe hotel in a good location for a few days in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: JMyersWirral
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, safe hotel. Our room was spacious with windows and a view. Our bathroom was also spacious with 'his and hers' washbasins. The room had a functioning safe which we used with our own combination and air conditioning that went on and off with the room entry card. The reception staff were helpful and we took breakfast in the light and airy dining room. This was good value, continental style with a few extras. The hotel is a short walk from the Sagrada Familia church where you can pick up the Tourist Bus. The nearest Metro stop is Guinardo on the yellow line which is just a short walk from the hotel past the new hospital. The yellow line goes to Passeig de Gracia metro which is conveniet for shopping and Plaza de Catalunia. Another stop is Jaume 1 convenient for The Born.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Goofymimi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aristol is a 3-star hotel located closed to the Unesco Heitage, Hospital de la Santa Creu I de Sant Pau. There are 2 metro station close by, the yellow line is slightly closer and you won’t need to climb up, convenient after a long hard day of walking. It wasn’t centrally located but nevertheless, easily accessed via metro. Towards the night the streets weren’t busy and one could hardly hear any traffic. The hotel is crisp and clean, with very friendly and helpful staff. The room was sufficiently comfortable to accommodate two people without invading into each other’s space. It also has air conditioner with temperature controller. Lighting was sufficient. A safe and a fridge were available. High speed internet worked very well, accessible from the room without problem. Downside is no drinking glass or in-room tea/coffee facility. Nevertheless, one night requested spoons to be sent to the room and the staff happily brought it up. The room was nicely furnished like a 3-star hotel expected. Bathroom was big, with a bathtub and a good-size counter and a huge mirror. The water pressure wasn’t very strong but water temperature was constant. Towel wasn’t replaced everyday, which did not bother us. The breakfast consisted of two types of hams, cheese, eggs, cereals, breads, fruits, and yogurt, slightly too expensive for what it is. Overall, the stay at Hotel Aristol was pleasant, for the price we paid (60 Euro/night without breakfast), it was a deal. Would certainly recommend it to others who do not mind to stay a bit away from the busy old town in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: julia93
Reviews.Content: We booked this for city break we were two couples. I read reviews and sounded mainly ok for the price it did state it had four floors. We landed at Girona caught the Barcelona bus outside straight to centre, then caught taxi to hotel. So when we entered hotel small lobby ,but clean, very helpfull. But I was suprised when we were told to go up in lift to fourth floor and walk the last flight of stairs which was a small flight. At the top of them were two doors right and left ,we had one each. Now I was worried had we been put in two small loft type bedrooms. Wow opened the door big bedroom probably one of the biggest I stayed in beautifully furnished an clean. The bathroom had big corner bath with shower over marble floor again lovely. By then my husband had found balcony doors which went round the side of the hotel and the view was amazing. Our friends had the same so between us there was not much you could not see. Breakfast was basic but enough, the cobs were fresh but it is just a cold buffet. When we left the hotel to go out we did look up at he hotel and could see no more balconies so they could be the only ones. If you went straight across and down the side of the hospital there is a metro and there metros take you anywhere ine the city and run every four minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: urbancocoa
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Aristol - I think it is definitely a great deal and would highly recommend it. Hotel Aristol is a three star hotel near the Guinardo (yellow line) metro station. I would compare it to a Holiday Inn in terms of the types and quality of rooms. The prices are low, it is clean and safe and ALL the rooms are non-smoking! The Hotel is in a great location- five-minute walk from a cute plaza area with numerous nice restaurants and bars, 2 blocks from the metro, and an easy 15 minute walk from Sagrada Familia. Not in the center of things, but conveniently located. We got a great price on the hotel from hotels[--].

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: meabhc_11
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 5 days in Barcelona (June 2006) and stayed in Hotel Aristol. I thought it was brilliant value for money. It was extremely clean, the room had everything you could need, the staff were helpful and the hotel was lovely and quiet at night because it wasn't in the city centre. I didn't find this a problem because the metro station was only 5 minutes walk from the hotel and the metro system was so quick and efficient, not to mention cheap! the only drawback of the hotel was that it was at the top of a steep hill, which meant a bit of a climb after getting off the metro. It didn't bother me but older travellers might find it a bit much. But if that doesn't put you off, I would recommend this hotel. I will definitely be staying there when I go back to Bracelona!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was pretty far away from the centre of Barcelona, although very close to the metro. It was clean and friendly with comfortable rooms, although being right on the corner of a roundabout was a bit noisy. Overall, decent value for money - but not great.
